Storage.A1.action_description: Registers the subscription for the storage resource provider and enables the creation of storage accounts.

Storage.A10.action_description: Deletes a specific version of a blob without affecting other versions or the current blob.

Storage.A100.action_description: The Get file properties operation returns all user-defined metadata, standard HTTP properties, and system properties for the file. It doesn't return the content of the file.

Storage.A101.action_description: Get a private endpoint connection proxy.

Storage.A103.action_description: List all private endpoint connection proxies.

Storage.A104.action_description: List all the private endpoint connections associated with the storage account.

Storage.A105.action_description: Deletes the specified private endpoint connection associated with the storage account.

Storage.A106.action_description: Gets the specified private endpoint connection associated with the storage account.

Storage.A107.action_description: Update the state of specified private endpoint connection associated with the storage account.

Storage.A108.action_description: Gets the Private Link resources that need to be created for a storage account.

Storage.A109.action_description: Checks that the storage account name is valid and is not already in use.

Storage.A11.action_description: This operation allows for the permanent deletion of soft-deleted blob snapshots or versions before the retention period expires.

Storage.A110.action_description: Deletes specified share under its account.

Storage.A111.action_description: Lists all shares. Gets properties of a specified share.

Storage.A112.action_description: Lists all shares. Gets properties of a specified share.

Storage.A113.action_description: Creates a new share under the specified account as described by request body. The share resource includes metadata and properties for that share. It does not include a list of the files contained by the share. Updates share properties as specified in request body. Properties not mentioned in the request will not be changed. Update fails if the specified share does not already exist.

Storage.A114.action_description: Returns the properties for the specified encryption scope.

Storage.A115.action_description: Synchronously creates or updates an encryption scope under the specified storage account. If an encryption scope is already created and a subsequent request is issued with different properties, the encryption scope properties will be updated per the specified request. Update encryption scope properties as specified in the request body. Update fails if the specified encryption scope does not already exist.

Storage.A12.action_description: Allows you to create a new blob or overwrite an existing blob within a container.

Storage.A121.action_description: Gets a data share policy for a specific account.

Storage.A122.action_description: Crates or updates a data share policy.

Storage.A123.action_description: Deletes the local user associated with the specified storage account.

Storage.A124.action_description: Regenerate the local user SSH password.

Storage.A125.action_description: List SSH authorized keys and Shared Key of the local user.

Storage.A126.action_description: List the local users associated with the storage account.

Storage.A127.action_description: Get the local user of the storage account by username.

Storage.A128.action_description: Create or update the properties of a local user associated with the storage account. Properties for NFSv3 enablement and extended Groups cannot be set with other properties.

Storage.A129.action_description: Gets the table with the specified table name, under the specified account if it exists. Gets a list of all the tables under the specified storage account.

Storage.A13.action_description: Allows you to search for blobs within a container based on their assigned tags.

Storage.A130.action_description: Creates a new table with the specified table name, under the specified account. Creates a new table with the specified table name, under the specified account.

Storage.A131.action_description: Deletes the table with the specified table name, under the specified account if it exists.

Storage.A132.action_description: Deletes the blob inventory policy associated with the specified storage account.

Storage.A133.action_description: Gets the blob inventory policy associated with the specified storage account.

Storage.A134.action_description: Sets the blob inventory policy to the specified storage account.

Storage.A135.action_description: Part of the Azure Management resource lock.

Storage.A14.action_description: Allows you to copy an existing blob to a new location within the same storage account or across different storage accounts.

Storage.A142.action_description: Insert, merge, or replace table entities.

Storage.A147.action_description: Create object replication restore point marker.

Storage.A15.action_description: Allows you to set system properties on the blob, such as cache control, content type, and metadata.

Storage.A151.action_description: Gets the status of the ongoing migration for the specified storage account.

Storage.A152.action_description: Customer is able to update their storage account redundancy for increased resiliency.

Storage.A153.action_description: Lists all containers and does not support a prefix like data plane. Also SRP today does not return continuation token. Gets properties of a specified container.

Storage.A154.action_description: Creates a new container under the specified account. If the container with the same name already exists, the operation fails returns all user-defined metadata and system properties for the specified container. The data returned does not include the container's list of blobs operation marks the specified container for deletion. The container and any blobs contained within it are later deleted during garbage collection restype.

Storage.A155.action_description: Set properties for the filesystem. This operation supports conditional HTTP requests. For more information, see [Specifying conditional Headers for blob service operations](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/API/storageservices/specifying-conditional-headers-for-blob-service-operations).

Storage.A156.action_description: List filesystem paths and their properties.

Storage.A157.action_description: List blob services of storage account. It returns a collection of one object named default. Gets the properties of a storage account's blob service, including properties for storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A158.action_description: Deletes specified container under its account.

Storage.A159.action_description: Create or rename a file or directory. By default, the destination is overwritten and if the destination already exists and has a lease the lease is broken. This operation supports conditional HTTP requests. For more information, see [Specifying conditional Headers for blob service operations](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/API/storageservices/specifying-conditional-headers-for-blob-service-operations). To fail if the destination already exists, use a conditional request with If-None-Match: "*".

Storage.A16.action_description: Manages access control and permissions for blobs within Azure Storage.

Storage.A160.action_description: Uploads data to be appended to a file, flushes (writes) previously uploaded data to a file, sets properties for a file or directory, or sets access control for a file or directory. Data can only be appended to a file. Concurrent writes to the same file using multiple clients are not supported. This operation supports conditional HTTP requests. For more information, see [Specifying conditional Headers for blob service operations](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/API/storageservices/specifying-conditional-headers-for-blob-service-operations).

Storage.A161.action_description: The Lease container operation establishes and manages a lock on a container for delete operations. The lock duration can be 15 to 60 seconds, or can be infinite.

Storage.A162.action_description: The "Download" operation reads or downloads a blob from the system, including its metadata and properties. You can also call "Download" to read a snapshot.

Storage.A163.action_description: The Get properties operation returns all user-defined metadata, standard HTTP properties, and system properties for the blob. It does not return the content of the blob.

Storage.A164.action_description: If the storage account's soft delete feature is disabled then, when a blob is deleted, it is permanently removed from the storage account. If the storage account's soft delete feature is enabled, then, when a blob is deleted, it is marked for deletion and becomes inaccessible immediately. However, the blob service retains the blob or snapshot for the number of days specified by the DeleteRetentionPolicy section of [storage service properties] (Set-Blob-Service-Properties.md). After the specified number of days has passed, the blob's data is permanently removed from the storage account. Note that you continue to be charged for the soft-deleted blob's storage until it is permanently removed. Use the "List Blobs" API and specify the "include=deleted" query parameter to discover which blobs and snapshots have been soft deleted. You can then use the Undelete blob API to restore a soft-deleted blob. All other operations on a soft-deleted blob or snapshot causes the service to return an HTTP status code of 404 (ResourceNotFound).

Storage.A165.action_description: Gets the current usage count and the limit for the resources under the subscription.

Storage.A167.action_description: Updates share properties as specified in request body. Properties not mentioned in the request will not be changed. Update fails if the specified share does not already exist.

Storage.A168.action_description: Gets properties of a specified share.

Storage.A169.action_description: Restore a file share within a valid retention days if share soft delete is enabled.

Storage.A170.action_description: The "Lease Share" operation establishes and manages a lock on a share for delete operations. The lock duration can be 15 to 60 seconds, or can be infinite.

Storage.A171.action_description: Gets list of effective NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfiguration for storage account.

Storage.A173.action_description: Refreshes any information about the association.

Storage.A174.action_description: Gets the queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account if it exists.

Storage.A175.action_description: Gets a list of all the queues under the specified storage account.

Storage.A176.action_description: Creates a new queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account.

Storage.A177.action_description: Creates a new queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account.

Storage.A178.action_description: Lists deleted accounts under the subscription.

Storage.A179.action_description: Get properties of specified deleted account resource.

Storage.A18.action_description: This operation migrates a blob container from container level WORM to object level immutability enabled container. Prerequisites require a container level immutability policy either in locked or unlocked state, account level versioning must be enabled and there should be no legal hold on the container.

Storage.A180.action_description: Gets the current usage count and the limit for the resources of the location under the subscription.

Storage.A181.action_description: Lists all the storage accounts available under the given resource group. Note that storage keys are not returned; use the ListKeys operation for this.

Storage.A182.action_description: Returns the properties for the specified storage account including but not limited to name, SKU name, location, and account status. The ListKeys operation should be used to retrieve storage keys.

Storage.A183.action_description: Lists all the encryption scopes available under the specified storage account.

Storage.A184.action_description: Update encryption scope properties as specified in the request body. Update fails if the specified encryption scope does not already exist.

Storage.A185.action_description: Gets the blob inventory policy associated with the specified storage account.

Storage.A186.action_description: Abort live migration of storage account to enable HNS.

Storage.A187.action_description: Account migration request can be triggered for a storage account to change its redundancy level. The migration updates the non-zonal redundant storage account to a zonal redundant account or vice-versa in order to have better reliability and availability. Zone-redundant storage (ZRS) replicates your storage account synchronously across three Azure Availability Zones in the primary region.

Storage.A188.action_description: List all the storage task assignments in an account.

Storage.A189.action_description: Get the storage task assignment properties.

Storage.A19.action_description: Updates container properties as specified in request body. Properties not mentioned in the request will be unchanged. Update fails if the specified container doesn't already exist.

Storage.A190.action_description: Asynchronously creates a new storage task assignment sub-resource with the specified parameters. If a storage task assignment is already created and a subsequent create request is issued with different properties, the storage task assignment properties will be updated. If a storage task assignment is already created and a subsequent create or update request is issued with the exact same set of properties, the request will succeed.

Storage.A192.action_description: Delete the storage task assignment sub-resource.

Storage.A193.action_description: Fetch the report summary of all the storage task assignments and instances in an account.

Storage.A194.action_description: Fetch the report summary of a single storage task assignment's instances.

Storage.A195.action_description: Gets a list of all the tables under the specified storage account.

Storage.A196.action_description: Gets the table with the specified table name, under the specified account if it exists.

Storage.A197.action_description: Creates a new table with the specified table name, under the specified account.

Storage.A198.action_description: Creates a new table with the specified table name, under the specified account.

Storage.A199.action_description: A failover request can be triggered for a storage account in the event a primary endpoint becomes unavailable for any reason. The failover occurs from the storage account's primary cluster to the secondary cluster for RA-GRS accounts. The secondary cluster will become primary after failover and the account is converted to LRS. In the case of a Planned failover, the primary and secondary clusters are swapped after failover and the account remains geo-replicated. Failover should continue to be used in the event of availability issues as Planned failover is only available while the primary and secondary endpoints are available. The primary use case of a Planned failover is Disaster Recovery testing drills. This type of failover is invoked by setting "FailoverType" parameter to 'Planned'. Learn more about the failover options here ref.

Storage.A2.action_description: Notifies Azure Storage that virtual network or subnet is being deleted.

Storage.A20.action_description: Deletes specified container under its account.

Storage.A201.action_description: Returns the list of storage connectors or gets the properties of specified storage connector.

Storage.A202.action_description: Test the connection of an existing storage connector.

Storage.A203.action_description: Creates or updates a storage connector.

Storage.A205.action_description: Returns the list of storage data shares or gets the properties of specified storage data share.

Storage.A206.action_description: Creates or updates a storage data share.

Storage.A21.action_description: Gets properties of a specified container.

Storage.A22.action_description: Lists all containers and does not support a prefix like data plane. Also SRP today does not return continuation token.

Storage.A23.action_description: The Lease container operation establishes and manages a lock on a container for delete operations. The lock duration can be 15 to 60 seconds, or can be infinite.

Storage.A24.action_description: Creates a new container under the specified account as described by request body. The container resource includes metadata and properties for that container. It does not include a list of the blobs contained by the container.

Storage.A25.action_description: Clears legal hold tags. Clearing the same or non-existing tag results in an idempotent operation. ClearLegalHold clears out only the specified tags in the request.

Storage.A26.action_description: Sets legal hold tags. Setting the same tag results in an idempotent operation. SetLegalHold follows an append pattern and does not clear out the existing tags that are not specified in the request.

Storage.A27.action_description: Extends the immutabilityPeriodSinceCreationInDays of a locked ImmutabilityPolicy. The only action allowed on a locked policy will be this action. ETag in If-Match is required for this operation.

Storage.A28.action_description: Aborts an unlocked immutability policy. The response of delete has immutabilityPeriodSinceCreationInDays set to 0. ETag in If-Match is required for this operation. Deleting a locked immutability policy is not allowed, the only way is to delete the container after deleting all expired blobs inside the policy locked container.

Storage.A29.action_description: Creates or updates an unlocked immutability policy. ETag in If-Match is honored if given but not required for this operation.

Storage.A3.action_description: List blob services of storage account. It returns a collection of one object named default.

Storage.A30.action_description: Sets the ImmutabilityPolicy to locked state. The only action allowed on a locked policy is ExtendImmutabilityPolicy action. ETag in If-Match is required for this operation.

Storage.A31.action_description: Gets the existing immutability policy along with the corresponding ETag in response Headers and body.

Storage.A32.action_description: List all queue services for the storage account.

Storage.A33.action_description: Gets the properties of a storage account's queue service, including properties for storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A34.action_description: Sets the properties of a storage account's queue service, including properties for storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A35.action_description: Creates a new queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account. Creates a new queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account.

Storage.A36.action_description: Gets the queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account if it exists. Gets a list of all the queues under the specified storage account.

Storage.A37.action_description: Creates a new queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account. Creates a new queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account.

Storage.A38.action_description: Deletes the queue with the specified queue name, under the specified account if it exists.

Storage.A39.action_description: Retrieves one or more messages from the front of the queue.

Storage.A4.action_description: Retrieves a user delegation key for the blob service. This is only a valid operation when using bearer token authentication.

Storage.A40.action_description: Adds a new message to the back of the message queue. A visibility time-out can also be specified to make the message invisible until the visibility time-out expires. A message must be in a format that can be included in an XML request with UTF-8 encoding. The encoded message can be up to 64 kibibytes (KiB) in size for version 2011-08-18 and later, or 8 KiB for earlier versions.

Storage.A41.action_description: Deletes the specified message from the queue.

Storage.A42.action_description: This operation allows you to add a new message to the back of a specified queue.

Storage.A43.action_description: Handles operations that involve processing messages in Azure Queue Storage. This encompasses actions such as retrieving messages from a queue, updating their visibility, and deleting them after processing.

Storage.A44.action_description: The update operation can be used to update the SKU, encryption, access tier, or tags for a storage account. It can also be used to map the account to a custom domain. Only one custom domain is supported per storage account; the replacement/change of custom domain is not supported.

Storage.A45.action_description: Live migration of storage account to enable HNS.

Storage.A46.action_description: Live migration of storage account to enable HNS.

Storage.A47.action_description: Restore blobs in the specified blob ranges.

Storage.A48.action_description: Used for approving or rejecting private endpoint connections for Azure Storage accounts.

Storage.A49.action_description: A failover request can be triggered for a storage account in the event a primary endpoint becomes unavailable for any reason. The failover occurs from the storage account's primary cluster to the secondary cluster for RA-GRS accounts. The secondary cluster will become primary after failover and the account is converted to LRS. In the case of a Planned failover, the primary and secondary clusters are swapped after failover and the account remains geo-replicated. Failover should continue to be used in the event of availability issues as Planned failover is only available while the primary and secondary endpoints are available. The primary use case of a Planned failover is Disaster Recovery testing drills. This type of failover is invoked by setting failoverType parameter to 'Planned'. Learn more about the failover options here- "https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-disaster-recovery-guidance".

Storage.A5.action_description: Sets the properties of a storage account's blob service, including properties for storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A50.action_description: Lists the access keys or Kerberos keys (if Active Directory enabled) for the specified storage account.

Storage.A51.action_description: Regenerates one of the access keys or Kerberos keys for the specified storage account.

Storage.A52.action_description: Used as part of the regenerate keys process.

Storage.A54.action_description: Deletes a storage account in Microsoft Azure.

Storage.A55.action_description: Lists all the storage accounts available under the subscription.

Storage.A56.action_description: List SAS credentials of a storage account.

Storage.A57.action_description: List service SAS credentials of a specific resource.

Storage.A58.action_description: Asynchronously creates a new storage account with the specified parameters. If an account is already created and a subsequent create request is issued with different properties, the account properties will be updated. If an account is already created and a subsequent create or update request is issued with the exact same set of properties, the request will succeed. The update operation can be used to update the SKU, encryption, access tier, or tags for a storage account.

Storage.A59.action_description: Configure monitoring and logging settings through Azure Resource Manager (ARM) APIs.

Storage.A6.action_description: Gets the properties of a storage account's blob service, including properties for storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A7.action_description: Returns a list of the blobs under the specified container.

Storage.A79.action_description: Lists the available SKUs supported by Microsoft.Storage for given subscription.

Storage.A8.action_description: Creates a new block, page, or append blob, or updates the content of an existing block blob. The Put blob operation will overwrite all contents of an existing blob with the same name.

Storage.A80.action_description: Lists all of the available storage REST API operations.

Storage.A81.action_description: Checks that the storage account name is valid and is not already in use.

Storage.A82.action_description: Gets the current usage count and the limit for the resources of the location under the subscription.

Storage.A83.action_description: Gets the current usage count and the limit for the resources under the subscription.

Storage.A84.action_description: The get tags operation enables users to get the tags associated with a blob.

Storage.A85.action_description: The set tags operation enables users to set the tags associated with a blob.

Storage.A86.action_description: Deletes the managementpolicy associated with the specified storage account.

Storage.A87.action_description: Gets the managementpolicy associated with the specified storage account.

Storage.A88.action_description: Sets the managementpolicy to the specified storage account.

Storage.A89.action_description: Used for operations that manage Azure file shares within a storage account.

Storage.A9.action_description: Deletes the specified blob or snapshot. Note that in order to delete a blob, you must delete all of its snapshots. You can delete both at the same time with the "Delete blob" operation.

Storage.A90.action_description: List all file services in storage accounts.

Storage.A91.action_description: Sets the properties of file services in storage accounts, including CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A92.action_description: Gets the properties of file services in storage accounts, including CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A93.action_description: List all table services for the storage account.

Storage.A94.action_description: Gets the properties of a storage account's table service, including properties for storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A95.action_description: Sets the properties of a storage account's table service, including properties for storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

Storage.A96.action_description: Reads or downloads a file from the system, including its metadata and properties.

Storage.A97.action_description: Creates a new file or replaces a file. When you call "Create File", you only initialize the file. To add content to a file, you call the "Put Range" operation.

Storage.A98.action_description: The Delete file operation immediately removes the file from the storage account.

Storage.A99.action_description: The Set file properties operation sets system properties on the file.

Storage.CO1.description: Limit the IAM entities allowed to use the IAM actions required to execute attacks

Storage.CO11.description: Enable enhanced monitoring and notifications for storage accounts

Storage.CO12.description: Enforce encryption on data at rest and protect encryption keys

Storage.CO14.description: Restrict and manage external websites (origins) that can make browser-based requests to storage accounts

Storage.CO21.description: Restrict access to Data Lake Storage, including SFTP, by integrating the IAM Operating Model

Storage.CO24.description: Protect the integrity of blob storage data from unauthorized changes

Storage.CO4.description: Restrict access to storage accounts and their services (e.g., Azure Files, containers, blobs, queues)

Storage.CO5.description: Ensure backup, replication, and recovery capabilities for storage account services

Storage.CO7.description: Restrict access to Data Lake Storage containers by integrating ACLs into the IAM Operating Model

Storage.CO9.description: Limit network access to storage account services with private endpoints

Storage.C1.description: Limit and monitor the access to the IAM actions required to perform attacks using Azure RBAC and local privileges, limiting them to Trusted Networks with Conditional Access and Just-in-Time access using Privileged Identity Management when possible, following the Entra ID, Azure Resource Manager, and Azure Management ThreatModels.
Storage.C1.testing: Request the list of authorized IAM principals with the permissions required to launch attacks, a list of Trusted Networks and PIM settings where applicable, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C10.description: Ensure versioning is enabled on required containers.
Storage.C10.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring versioning is enabled on required containers, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C100.description: Prevent file shares that do not require NFS/SMB 2.1 from being enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/fileServices/protocolSettings.smb.protocolVersions[*]": ["SMB2.1"]} in Deny mode).
Storage.C100.testing: Modify an existing file share that does not require NFS/SMB 2.1 to use NFS/SMB 2.1; it should be denied.

Storage.C101.description: Monitor the creation or update of Azure Files NFS/SMB 2.1 and corresponding settings (e.g., using activity logs on properties.supportsHttpsTrafficOnly scope "supportsHttpsTrafficOnly").
Storage.C101.testing: Modify or create a file share that does not require NFS/SMB 2.1 to use NFS/SMB 2.1; it should be detected.

Storage.C102.description: Verify only file shares that require NFS/SMB 2.1 have it enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/fileServices/protocolSettings.smb.protocolVersions[*]": ["SMB2.1"]} in Audit mode).
Storage.C102.testing: Modify an existing file share that does not require NFS/SMB 2.1 to use NFS/SMB 2.1; it should be detected.

Storage.C107.description: Maintain the list of storage accounts that should require read-only and/or delete locks.
Storage.C107.testing: Request the list of storage accounts that require read-only and/or delete locks, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C108.description: Ensure only required storage accounts have read-only and/or delete locks applied.
Storage.C108.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring required storage accounts have read-only and/or delete locks applied, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C109.description: Verify required storage accounts have read-only and/or delete locks applied (e.g., by using built-in Azure Policy "Resource locks should be applied" in Audit mode).
Storage.C109.testing: Remove a read-only or delete lock from a storage account; it should be detected.

Storage.C11.description: Verify versioning is enabled on required containers (e.g., by using Azure built-in policy "Configure your Storage account to enable blob versioning" in Audit mode).
Storage.C11.testing: Remove versioning from a container; it should be detected.

Storage.C110.description: Prevent modification or deletion of required storage accounts by using a resource lock set to read-only and/or delete, using the Azure Resource Manager ThreatModel.
Storage.C110.testing: Modify or delete a required storage account; it should be denied.

Storage.C111.description: Maintain a list of Data Lake Storage accounts that require SFTP enabled.
Storage.C111.testing: Request the list of storage accounts that require SFTP, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C114.description: Ensure only storage accounts that require SFTP have it enabled.
Storage.C114.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring storage accounts that require SFTP have it enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C115.description: Prevent storage accounts that do not require SFTP from having it enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/isSftpEnabled": true} in Deny mode).
Storage.C115.testing: Modify a storage account that does not require SFTP to use SFTP; it should be denied.

Storage.C116.description: Verify only storage accounts that require SFTP have it enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/isSftpEnabled": true} in Audit mode).
Storage.C116.testing: Modify a storage account that does not require SFTP to use SFTP; it should be detected.

Storage.C12.description: Ensure snapshots are enabled for required file shares.
Storage.C12.testing: Request 1) the mechanism that ensures snapshots are enabled for required file shares, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C120.description: Maintain a list of required file shares' security protocol settings (ideally maximum security SMB 3.1.1, Kerberos, AES-256 only).
Storage.C120.testing: Request the list of required file share security protocol settings, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C121.description: Ensure required file shares' security protocol settings are set.
Storage.C121.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring that the required security protocol settings for file shares in storage accounts are in use, 2) its records of execution for all new file shares, and 3) the plan to move any older file shares.

Storage.C122.description: Prevent security protocol settings from changing on required file shares (e.g., by using custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/fileServices/protocolSettings.smb": {"kerberosTicketEncryption":"AES256","channelEncryption":"Required"}} in Deny mode).
Storage.C122.testing: Modify a required file share's security protocol settings; it should be denied.

Storage.C123.description: Verify required file shares' security protocol settings are configured (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/fileServices/protocolSettings.smb": {"kerberosTicketEncryption":"AES256","channelEncryption":"Required"}} in Audit mode).
Storage.C123.testing: Modify a required file share's security protocol settings; it should be detected.

Storage.C13.description: Verify snapshots are enabled for required file shares (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"properties.shareSnapshotEnabled": false} in Audit mode).
Storage.C13.testing: Disable snapshotting from a required file share; it should be detected.

Storage.C144.description: Maintain a list of storage account blobs that require versioning and blob change feed to be enabled.
Storage.C144.testing: Request the list of storage account blobs that require versioning and blob change feed enabled, along with its review process and review records.

Storage.C145.description: Maintain a list of Azure Files that require snapshots.
Storage.C145.testing: Request the list of Azure Files that require snapshots, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C146.description: Verify required storage container blobs have immutability and soft delete enabled (e.g., by using built-in Azure Policy "Immutable blob storage should be enabled" in Audit mode).
Storage.C146.testing: Turn off immutability on a storage container blob that requires it to be enabled; it should be detected.

Storage.C147.description: Maintain a list of storage blobs that require Azure Backup.
Storage.C147.testing: Request the list of storage blobs that require Azure Backup, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C149.description: Ensure required blobs, file shares, queues, tables, and DFS are using authorized authentication methods.
Storage.C149.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring blobs, file shares, queues, tables, and DFS use authorized authentication methods, 2) its records of execution for new storage account services, and 3) the plan to move any older storage account services.

Storage.C15.description: Maintain a list of the blob storage containers that are required to have a minimum retention period enabled.
Storage.C15.testing: Request the list of storage account containers that have a minimum retention period according to requirements, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C150.description: Maintain a list of authorized replication policies and their destination storage accounts.
Storage.C150.testing: Request the list of authorized replication policies and their destination storage accounts, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C151.description: Ensure replication policies and their destination storage accounts are authorized.
Storage.C151.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring replication policies and their destination storage accounts are authorized, 2) its records of execution for all new replication policies, and 3) the plan to move any older replication policies.

Storage.C152.description: Verify replication policies and their destination storage accounts are authorized (e.g., by using custom Azure Policy in Audit mode).
Storage.C152.testing: Add an unauthorized replication policy; it should be detected.

Storage.C156.description: Ensure all stored access policy permissions are authorized on each container, file share, queue, and table.
Storage.C156.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring all stored access policies and their permissions are authorized, 2) its records of execution for all new containers, file shares, queues, and tables, and 3) the plan to move any older containers, file shares, queues, and tables.

Storage.C157.description: Verify all stored access policy permissions are authorized (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy with your allowedPermissions variable set to the permissions you've authorized in Audit mode).
Storage.C157.testing: Modify an existing stored access policy's permissions; it should be detected.

Storage.C158.description: Maintain a list of authorized Access Control Lists (ACLs) on Data Lake Storage containers.
Storage.C158.testing: Request the list of authorized Access Control Lists (ACLs) on Data Lake Storage containers, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C159.description: Ensure all Access Control Lists (ACLs) on Data Lake Storage containers are authorized.
Storage.C159.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring all Access Control Lists (ACLs) on Data Lake Storage containers are authorized, 2) its records of execution for all new ACLs, and 3) the plan to move any older ACLs.

Storage.C16.description: Ensure required storage accounts have the soft-delete feature for blobs enabled for the defined minimum retention period.
Storage.C16.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring required storage accounts have soft-delete for blobs enabled for at least the defined minimum retention, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C160.description: Verify all Access Control Lists (ACLs) on Data Lake Storage containers are authorized (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on "where": {"field": "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers/acl[*].id", "notIn": "[parameters (\"authorizedPrincipals\")]"} in Audit mode).
Storage.C160.testing: Create a new ACL; it should be detected.

Storage.C161.description: Maintain a list of authorized local users, their permissions, and their authentication methods (e.g., password, SSH) for each hierarchical namespace with SFTP enabled.
Storage.C161.testing: Request the list of authorized local users, their permissions, their authentication methods, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C162.description: Ensure all local users and associated permissions and authentication methods are authorized.
Storage.C162.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring all local users and associated permissions and authentication methods are authorized, 2) its records of execution for all new local users, and 3) the plan to move any older local users.

Storage.C163.description: Verify all local users and associated permissions and authentication methods are authorized (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on "where": {"field": "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/localUsers/permissionScopes[*].permissions", "notIn": "[parameters (\"allowedPermissions\")]"} in Audit mode).
Storage.C163.testing: Create a new local user; it should be detected.

Storage.C17.description: Prevent the creation of required storage accounts without the blob soft-delete option enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/deleteRetentionPolicy.enabled": false} in Deny mode).
Storage.C17.testing: Create a required storage account without soft-delete for the blob; it should be denied.

Storage.C18.description: Verify required storage accounts have the blob soft-delete option enabled (e.g., by using custom Azure Policy in Audit mode).
Storage.C18.testing: Create a required storage account without soft-delete for the blob option; it should be detected.

Storage.C19.description: Ensure required storage accounts have the soft-delete option enabled for the containers.
Storage.C19.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring required storage accounts have soft-delete for the container enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new required storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older required storage accounts.

Storage.C2.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts and their authorized authentication methods enabled according to requirements (e.g., Entra ID, SAS token).
Storage.C2.testing: Request the list of storage accounts and their authorized authentication methods, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C20.description: Prevent the creation of containers without the soft-delete option enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers/softDelete" in Deny mode).
Storage.C20.testing: Create a container without soft-delete; it should be denied.

Storage.C21.description: Verify required storage accounts have container soft delete enabled (e.g., by using custom Azure Policy in Audit mode).
Storage.C21.testing: Create a storage account without soft-delete for the container option; it should be detected.

Storage.C22.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts that require hierarchical namespace (i.e., Data Lake Storage) and SSH enabled.
Storage.C22.testing: Request the list of storage accounts that require hierarchical namespace, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C23.description: Ensure all required storage accounts have hierarchical namespace (i.e., Data Lake Storage) enabled.
Storage.C23.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring required storage accounts have hierarchical namespace enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new required storage accounts, 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts with hierarchical namespace.

Storage.C24.description: Verify only required storage accounts have the hierarchical namespace (HNS) option enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"isHnsEnabled": "true"} in Audit mode).
Storage.C24.testing: Create a non-required storage account with the hierarchical namespace (HNS) option enabled; it should be detected.

Storage.C26.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts that allow SAS token authentication, its allowed services, and its allowed permissions.
Storage.C26.testing: Request the list of storage accounts authorized to use SAS token authentication, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C27.description: Ensure SAS token authentication is enabled only for storage accounts that allow it.
Storage.C27.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only storage accounts that allow SAS token authentication have it enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts that allow SAS token authentication.

Storage.C28.description: Verify only storage accounts allowing SAS token authentication have it enabled (e.g., by using Azure built-in policy StorageAccountAllowSharedKeyAccess_Audit.json).
Storage.C28.testing: Enable SAS token authentication on a storage account that should not allow it; it should be detected.

Storage.C32.description: Maintain a list of storage container blobs that require immutability and soft delete.
Storage.C32.testing: Request the list of storage container blobs that require immutability, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C33.description: Ensure required storage container blobs have immutability and soft delete enabled.
Storage.C33.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring that required storage container blobs have immutability enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new storage container blobs, and 3) the plan to move any older storage container blobs.

Storage.C37.description: Maintain a list of authorized private endpoints on storage accounts.
Storage.C37.testing: Request the list of authorized private endpoints, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C38.description: Ensure only authorized private endpoints are configured on storage accounts.
Storage.C38.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only authorized private endpoints are configured on storage accounts, 2) its records of execution for all private endpoints.

Storage.C40.description: Verify only authorized private endpoints are configured on storage accounts (e.g., by using the built-in Azure Policy "Storage accounts should use Private Link" in Audit mode).
Storage.C40.testing: Configure an unauthorized private endpoint on a storage account; it should be detected.

Storage.C42.description: Maintain a list of authorized IPs that are permitted through each storage account firewall.
Storage.C42.testing: Request the list of authorized IPs, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C43.description: Ensure each storage account firewall only allows authorized IPs.
Storage.C43.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring firewall rules only allow authorized IP addresses, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C44.description: Prevent access from unauthorized IPs by allowing only authorized IPs through the Azure Storage firewall (by using built-in Azure Policy "Storage accounts should restrict network access" in Deny mode).
Storage.C44.testing: Access from unauthorized IPs; it should be denied.

Storage.C45.description: Verify only authorized IPs are permitted through each storage account firewall (e.g., by using built-in Azure Policy "Storage accounts should restrict network access" in Audit mode).
Storage.C45.testing: Connect to a storage account from an unauthorized IP; it should be detected.

Storage.C46.description: Ensure storage blobs are using Azure Backup, following the requirements in the Azure Backup ThreatModel.
Storage.C46.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring storage blobs are using Azure Backup, 2) its records of execution for all new storage blobs, and 3) the plan to move any older storage blobs.

Storage.C47.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts that require cross-tenant replication and their allowed destination tenants.
Storage.C47.testing: Request the list of storage accounts that require cross-tenant replication and their allowed destination tenants, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C48.description: Ensure only required storage accounts have cross-tenant replication enabled and the destination storage accounts are authorized.
Storage.C48.testing: Request 1) the mechanism that ensures only required storage accounts have cross-tenant replication enabled and the destination storage accounts are authorized, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C49.description: Verify only the storage accounts that require cross-tenant replication have it enabled (e.g., by using Azure built-in policy StorageAccountAllowCrossTenantReplication_Audit.json).
Storage.C49.testing: Create a storage account with cross-tenant replication enabled; it should be detected.

Storage.C50.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts that require diagnostic settings to be enabled and their respective log destinations.
Storage.C50.testing: Request the list of storage accounts that require diagnostic settings, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C51.description: Ensure diagnostic settings are enabled on storage accounts that require it, and their respective log destinations are authorized.
Storage.C51.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only authorized diagnostic settings destinations are enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C54.description: Verify storage accounts have diagnostic settings configured (e.g., by using built-in Azure Policy "Configure diagnostic settings for storage accounts to Log Analytics workspace" in Audit mode).
Storage.C54.testing: Create a storage account with unauthorized diagnostic settings options; it should be detected.

Storage.C55.description: Maintain a list of blobs and containers that require anonymous access.
Storage.C55.testing: Request the list of authorized blobs and containers that require anonymous access, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C56.description: Ensure anonymous access is set only for required blobs and containers.
Storage.C56.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only required blobs/containers are anonymously accessible, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C57.description: Ensure only required blobs and containers are anonymously accessible (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers/publicAccess": "Blob"} in Deny mode).
Storage.C57.testing: Create or update a non-required blob or a container to be anonymously accessible; it should be denied.

Storage.C59.description: Verify only required blobs or containers are anonymously accessible (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers/publicAccess": "Blob"} in Audit mode).
Storage.C59.testing: Create or update a non-required blob or a container to be anonymously accessible; it should be detected.

Storage.C6.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts that require public access to be enabled.
Storage.C6.testing: Request the list of required storage accounts with public access enabled, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C60.description: Maintain a list of authorized customer-managed keys used by storage accounts.
Storage.C60.testing: Request the list of authorized customer-managed keys used by storage accounts, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C61.description: Ensure only authorized customer-managed keys are configured for storage accounts.
Storage.C61.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only authorized customer-managed keys are used to encrypt each storage account, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older authorized storage accounts.

Storage.C63.description: Prevent storage accounts that require customer-managed keys from using service-managed keys (e.g., by using built-in Azure Policy "Storage accounts should use customer-managed key for encryption" in Deny mode).
Storage.C63.testing: Create a storage account requiring CMK with a service-managed key; it should be denied.

Storage.C65.description: Verify only authorized customer-managed keys are configured for storage accounts (e.g., by using the built-in Azure Policy "Storage accounts should use customer-managed key for encryption" in Audit mode).
Storage.C65.testing: Modify a required storage account to use an unauthorized CMK; it should be detected.

Storage.C7.description: Ensure only required storage accounts have public access enabled.
Storage.C7.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only required storage accounts have public access enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C71.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts that require redundancy.
Storage.C71.testing: Request the list of storage accounts that require redundancy, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C72.description: Ensure required storage accounts use redundancy.
Storage.C72.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring required storage accounts use redundancy, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C74.description: Verify required storage accounts use redundancy (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/sku.name": ["Standard_GRS","Standard_ZRS"]} in Audit mode).
Storage.C74.testing: Remove a redundancy configuration from a storage account; it should be detected.

Storage.C75.description: Maintain a list of authorized storage account regions that can be used for redundancy.
Storage.C75.testing: Request the list of authorized storage account regions that are used for redundancy, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C76.description: Ensure the authorized storage account region used for redundancy is configured.
Storage.C76.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only authorized regions for storage accounts are in use, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C77.description: Ensure only the authorized storage account region is set for redundancy (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"location": ["eastus","westeurope"]} in Deny mode).
Storage.C77.testing: Create a redundancy configuration on a storage account with an unauthorized region; it should be denied.

Storage.C78.description: Verify only the authorized storage account region is set for redundancy (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy with {"location": ["eastus","westeurope"]} in Audit mode).
Storage.C78.testing: Create a storage account with an unauthorized region; it should be detected.

Storage.C8.description: Prevent the creation or update of non-required storage accounts with public access enabled (e.g., by using Azure built-in policy "Storage accounts should disable public network access" in Deny mode).
Storage.C8.testing: Modify a non-required storage account to have public access enabled; it should be denied.

Storage.C81.description: Verify only the authorized authorization methods are set for authorized blobs, file shares, queues, tables, and DFS (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/protocolSettings.authenticationMethods[*]": ["SharedKey","AzureAD"]} in Audit mode).
Storage.C81.testing: Configure a blob, file share, queue, table, or DFS with an unauthorized authorization method; it should be detected.

Storage.C83.description: Define the minimum retention period for required file shares (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/fileServices/deleteRetentionPolicy.days": 7} in Deny mode).
Storage.C83.testing: For each file share, request the minimum retention from deletion, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C84.description: Ensure file shares have the soft-delete option enabled for at least the defined minimum retention period.
Storage.C84.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring file shares have soft-delete enabled for at least the defined minimum retention, 2) its records of execution for all new file shares, and 3) the plan to move any older file shares.

Storage.C85.description: Prevent the creation of file shares without the soft-delete option enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/fileServices/shares/deleteRetentionPolicy.enabled": false} in Deny mode).
Storage.C85.testing: Create a file share without soft-delete; it should be denied.

Storage.C86.description: Verify all file shares have the soft-delete option enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/fileServices/shares/deleteRetentionPolicy.enabled": false} in Audit mode).
Storage.C86.testing: Create a file share without soft-delete; it should be detected.

Storage.C9.description: Verify non-required storage accounts do not have public access enabled (e.g., by using Azure built-in policy "Storage accounts should disable public network access" in Audit mode).
Storage.C9.testing: Modify a non-required storage account to have public access enabled; it should be detected.

Storage.C90.description: Maintain a list of storage accounts that require static website hosting.
Storage.C90.testing: Request the list of storage accounts that require static website hosting, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C91.description: Ensure only storage accounts that require static website hosting have it enabled.
Storage.C91.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only required storage accounts have the static website hosting enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C92.description: Prevent storage accounts that do not require static website hosting from having it enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/staticWebsite.enabled": true} in Deny mode).
Storage.C92.testing: Modify an existing storage account that does not require static website hosting to be enabled; it should be denied.

Storage.C93.description: Verify storage accounts that do not require static website hosting do not have it enabled (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/staticWebsite.enabled": true} in Audit mode).
Storage.C93.testing: Modify an existing storage account that does not require static website hosting to be enabled; it should be detected.

Storage.C94.description: Maintain a list of authorized CORS per endpoint, trusted origins, and corresponding settings.
Storage.C94.testing: Request the list of authorized storage accounts with CORS trusted origins and corresponding settings, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C95.description: Ensure only authorized storage accounts have CORS-trusted origins and corresponding settings configured.
Storage.C95.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only authorized storage accounts have CORS trusted origins and corresponding settings configured, 2) its records of execution for all new storage accounts, and 3) the plan to move any older storage accounts.

Storage.C96.description: Prevent unauthorized storage accounts from using CORS trusted origins and corresponding settings (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/cors.allowedOrigins[*]": ["https://myapp.contoso.com"]} in Deny mode).
Storage.C96.testing: Create a storage account with untrusted CORS settings; it should be denied.

Storage.C97.description: Verify only authorized CORS trusted origins and corresponding settings are configured (e.g., by using a custom Azure Policy on {"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/cors.allowedOrigins[*]": ["https://myapp.contoso.com"]} in Audit mode).
Storage.C97.testing: Create a storage account with untrusted CORS settings; it should be detected.

Storage.C98.description: Maintain a list of file shares that require NFS/SMB 2.1 enabled.
Storage.C98.testing: Request the list of file shares that require NFS/SMB 2.1 enabled, its review process, and its review records.

Storage.C99.description: Ensure only file shares that require NFS/SMB 2.1 have it enabled.
Storage.C99.testing: Request 1) the mechanism ensuring only file shares that require NFS/SMB 2.1 have it enabled, 2) its records of execution for all new file shares, and 3) the plan to move any older file shares.

Storage.FC1.description: Azure Storage is Microsoft's Cloud Storage solution for modern data storage scenarios. Azure Storage offers a scalable object store for data objects, a file system service for the cloud, a messaging store for reliable messaging, and a NoSQL store.
Storage.FC1.name: Storage account

Storage.FC10.description: The Azure Storage blob inventory feature provides an overview of your containers, blobs, snapshots, and blob versions within a storage account. Use the inventory report to understand various attributes of blobs and containers, such as the total data size, age, encryption status, immutability policy, and legal hold.
Storage.FC10.name: Blob inventory

Storage.FC11.description: Blob storage supports the SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP). This support lets you securely connect to blob storage via an SFTP endpoint, allowing you to use SFTP for file access, file transfer, and file management.
Storage.FC11.name: Local users

Storage.FC12.description: Azure Storage private endpoint is a network interface that enables secure, private connectivity between Azure Storage and virtual networks using Azure Private Link, preventing exposure to the public internet and enhancing security.
Storage.FC12.name: Private endpoints

Storage.FC2.description: Object storage solution for storing unstructured data (blobs) accessible via HTTP/S and optionally via the Network File System (NFS) v3 and SFTP protocols.
Storage.FC2.name: Blob storage

Storage.FC3.description: Azure Files offers fully governed file shares in the cloud accessible via Server Message Block (SMB) protocol, Network File System (NFS) v4.1 protocol, or the in-preview Azure Files REST API.
Storage.FC3.name: File shares

Storage.FC4.description: Azure Queue Storage is a service for storing messages. Access messages via HTTP/S calls.
Storage.FC4.name: Queues

Storage.FC5.description: Azure table storage is a service that stores non-relational structured data (or structured NoSQL data) in the cloud, providing a key/attribute store with a schemaless design.
Storage.FC5.name: Tables

metadata.license: ThreatModel for Azure Storage, by TrustOnCloud, under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA 4.0). Find latest source at https://github.com/trustoncloud/threatmodel-for-azure-storage

identity_management.score:
Azure RBAC,
storage account key,
local SFTP users,
Entra ID,
AD DS,
Azure AD Kerberos

network_filtering.score:
VNET security,
Storage Account Firewall, Private endpoint

resource_based.score:
file share ACL,
queue ACL, table ACL,
storage account access keys,
SAS tokens

Storage.T1.description: Storage accounts can have up to 2 storage access keys with unrestricted permissions on a storage account. An attacker can generate a new storage access key or use an existing key to gain unrestricted access.
Storage.T1.name: Privilege escalation using storage account access key

Storage.T10.description: An attacker can alter diagnostic settings at the storage account or container level, allowing them to redirect storage account logs to another tenant or subscription to exfiltrate data.
Storage.T10.name: Defense evasion by modifying diagnostic settings

Storage.T12.description: Blob storage supports any file object. An attacker can overwrite a legitimate file with malware and infect internal services or external users.
Storage.T12.name: Execution of malware through file replacement

Storage.T13.description: Replication allows you to replicate objects and their metadata. An attacker can configure replication on a storage account to replicate objects (or their metadata or tags) to exfiltrate data.
Storage.T13.name: Unauthorized access to data via storage account replication

Storage.T15.description: Data stored on a file share using SMB or NFS v4.1 protocols can be accessed using REST APIs with the HTTP/S protocol. An attacker can access data using a different access method to gain access to the data.
Storage.T15.name: Exfiltrate data using different access methods

Storage.T16.description: Blob storage is billed based on usage. An attacker can upload terabytes of data to the storage account and cause billing implications.
Storage.T16.name: Denial of Wallet (DoW) through the upload of files to a storage account

Storage.T18.description: File shares, similar to the DFS, have a hierarchical architecture. An attacker can potentially delete multiple directories and files recursively.
Storage.T18.name: Recursively delete directories and their contents in the file share

Storage.T2.description: SAS tokens can be signed from a storage account access key, enabling non-Azure applications to access data in a storage account. An attacker can rotate or regenerate a storage account access key to invalidate its SAS tokens, blocking data access to any applications using SAS tokens derived from this access key.
Storage.T2.name: DoS due to storage account access key regeneration

Storage.T20.description: File share services in Azure allow machines to mount the share via SMB. An attacker can distribute malicious files by uploading them to the file share service.
Storage.T20.name: Distribute malicious files via file share

Storage.T22.description: A storage account can be configured as a static website server. An attacker can distribute malicious and infected files or exfiltrate data via a website hosted on a storage account (i.e., through the $web directory).
Storage.T22.name: Exfiltrate files via the static website feature

Storage.T24.description: Storage blobs have inventory lists to track the objects they contain. An attacker can access the blob inventory, obtaining knowledge about running services, and exfiltrate metadata.
Storage.T24.name: Exfiltrate metadata using blob inventory functionality

Storage.T25.description: Blob Storage lifecycle management allows implementing rule-based policies that automatically transition data to cooler tiers or expire it when it's no longer needed. An attacker can create or modify the Blob Storage lifecycle management settings to delete data or impact data latency.
Storage.T25.name: Delete data using Blob Storage lifecycle management

Storage.T26.description: CORS is an HTTP feature that enables a web application running under one domain to access resources in another domain. An attacker can modify the CORS policy on a storage account if it has HTTP access enabled and gain privileged access via origin reflection, enticing a user to access a page with a malicious script and return sensitive data.
Storage.T26.name: Unauthorized data exposure by modifying CORS settings

Storage.T27.description: Queue access policies limit access to entities via the queue share endpoint when using a SAS token. An attacker can modify these access policies to escalate their privileges.
Storage.T27.name: Privilege escalation by modifying queue access policy

Storage.T28.description: Table access policies are used to limit access to entities via the table endpoint when using a SAS token. An attacker can modify these access policies to escalate their privileges.
Storage.T28.name: Privilege escalation by modifying table access policy

Storage.T31.description: Messages in queues can be purged and deleted; queues can be deleted with all the messages, and queue parameter changes can result in losing all the messages. An attacker can delete or alter the messages and queues using any method, impacting downstream applications and processes, and causing loss of integrity and DoS.
Storage.T31.name: Impacting queue's message integrity or complete loss of sensitive data

Storage.T34.description: Query acceleration is used for data processing applications and can be executed on a storage account. Due to the increased compute load within the Azure Data Lake Storage service, the pricing model for query acceleration differs from the normal Azure Data Lake Storage transaction model. An attacker can execute the queries and generate costs.
Storage.T34.name: Cost increase by executing Azure Data Lake Storage query acceleration

Storage.T38.description: Data at rest can be encrypted with customer managed keys. An attacker can change the encryption key, causing a data integrity failure.
Storage.T38.name: Data integrity failure by tampering with encryption-at-rest key

Storage.T39.description: Disabling blob soft delete allows the ability to continue recovering soft-deleted objects in the storage account until the soft delete retention period has elapsed. An attacker can disable soft delete to compromise the service.
Storage.T39.name: Service compromise by disabling soft delete

Storage.T4.description: Azure Storage account names are globally unique. An attacker can take over an old or existing account name, delete one, and trick any third party to use their account to steal or distribute malicious data.
Storage.T4.name: Distribute malicious data by using the storage account name

Storage.T42.description: Replication is a level of integrity protection and backup. An attacker can remove replication to affect data protection in the event of a fail over.
Storage.T42.name: Denial of Service by removing replication

Storage.T44.description: Storage accounts support SFTP and local accounts. An attacker can maintain persistence in a Storage account by creating SFTP local-user credentials.
Storage.T44.name: Persistent access to data by creating SFTP local user credentials

Storage.T49.description: A blob created before October 20, 2017 may not have been encrypted and must be recreated to enforce encryption. An attacker can abuse this to gain access to sensitive data.
Storage.T49.name: Information disclosure due to unencrypted blob storage

Storage.T5.description: Azure Storage account blobs support anonymous public access. An attacker can create or modify a container to make it public and steal/exfiltrate/expose data.
Storage.T5.name: Unauthorized access to data by allowing anonymous public access

Storage.T50.description: Administrators configure network rules to allow only requests originating from authorized subnets. An attacker can insert or modify the rules to gain access.
Storage.T50.name: Access to Storage account resources by modifying virtual network rules

Storage.T59.description: Azure Storage accounts support failover, which transitions geo-redundant storage accounts from their primary region to the secondary, deleting the original primary data and converting the account to locally redundant storage. An attacker can initiate an unauthorized failover to disrupt availability, cause loss of unreplicated data, degrade redundancy, and introduce inconsistencies due to asynchronous replication.
Storage.T59.name: Unauthorized failover through configuration change

Storage.T60.description: Azure file shares support different levels of encryption for data-in-transit, including no encryption. An attacker can disable encryption on a file share to expose the contents of the share.
Storage.T60.name: Data exposure by changing encryption type

Storage.T61.description: Azure file shares support SMB version 2.1, which has several known vulnerabilities. An attacker can set the SMB version to a vulnerable one and abuse the protocol to collect sensitive data.
Storage.T61.name: Data exposure through exploitation of legacy protocols

Storage.T62.description: Azure Storage accounts support private endpoints as a way to access the service endpoints in a private network. An attacker can disable or delete the private endpoints, causing a Denial of Service.
Storage.T62.name: Denial of Service by deleting private endpoint

Storage.T63.description: Replication policies allow continuous replication of objects (files, blobs, etc.). An attacker can set up a rogue replication policy to continuously replicate objects to a storage account they control, including being located in an external tenant.
Storage.T63.name: Exfiltration through rogue replication policy

Storage.T64.description: Azure file shares support SMB authentication via Shared Key (in the form of a password). An attacker can list this key through an API call, giving them full access to the file share.
Storage.T64.name: Credential access through accessing SMB Shared Key

Storage.T65.description: Azure file shares support SMB authentication via Shared Key (in the form of a password). An attacker can use this key to access and mount the file share, bypassing control plane API calls and logging.
Storage.T65.name: File share access through SMB Shared Key

Storage.T66.description: Azure Data Lake Storage containers support Access Control Lists (ACLs). An attacker can modify these ACLs to escalate their permissions.
Storage.T66.name: Privilege escalation through modification of ACL

Storage.T7.description: Distributed file systems have a hierarchical architecture. An attacker can delete multiple directories and files recursively to make them unavailable.
Storage.T7.name: Recursively delete DFS directories and their content

Storage.T8.description: Blob storage in Azure allows CRUD operations. An attacker can modify data, leading to data manipulation.
Storage.T8.name: Unauthorized modification of data

Storage.T9.description: An attacker can encrypt or overwrite files and objects in DFS or blobs using an encryption key under their control and request a ransom to access the decryption key.
Storage.T9.name: Encrypt/overwrite files with ransomware in DFS/blob
